Authors:
Thiyagaraja Vinodhini, Kevin D Hyde, Dhanushka Nadeeshan
Wanasinghe, Trevor H. Worthy, Samantha C Karunarathna
Title:
orphology and phylogenetic placement of Alpinaria rhododendri
(Melanommataceae, Ascomycota); a new record from China
Abstract:
The recently established monotypic Alpinaria comprises A.
rhododendri. It occurs on Rhododendron species and is distributed across
Europe, India and North America. The genus was previously established to
epitypify Cucurbitaria rhododendri, referring to its alpine habitat, and
was assigned to Melanommataceae based on multigene phylogenetic
analysis. In this study, a fungal taxon growing on unidentified
dicotyledonous wood was collected from Shangri La, Yunnan Province,
China. Our taxon clustered with Alpinaria in the combined LSU, SSU, ITS
and TEF1-α phylogenetic tree, constructed based on maximum likelihood
and Bayesian analyses. Our collection is characterized by globose,
ostiolate ascomata, septate pseudoparaphyses, cylindrical, bitunicate,
fissitunicate asci and 8-spored, ellipsoid and septate ascospores.
Morphology and phylogenetic analyses support the identification of our
taxon as A. rhododendri, a new record for China.
